intro: Astronia brunneoaenea, commonly known as the brown-leaved astronia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are typically brownish in color, giving it its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Astronia brunneoaenea is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
